title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about Tuesday’s wind chill, potential for flurries
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: National Weather Service warns of unseasonably cold and windy conditions with possible flurries in the Berkshires.
Wind chills in Boston expected to remain in the 20s with highs reaching only 35-40 degrees, reports WCVB.
Rain on Sunday could begin as a wintry mix near and north of Route 2, according to WCVB forecasts.

title: Love Letters notes on Veterans Day
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters takes a break for Veterans Day, resumes normal activities tomorrow.
A contest is announced for a chance to attend a special event with author Elin Hilderbrand.
The latest Love Letters podcast features a conversation with sports columnist Christopher L. Gasper.

title: After loss to Warren, Republican John Deaton announces another run for Senate
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: John Deaton, a Marine veteran and lawyer, announced his run for Sen. Ed Markey's seat in the 2026 election.
Deaton previously ran against Elizabeth Warren, emphasizing his moderate Republican stance and support for Roe v. Wade.
Sen. Markey faces a primary challenge from Rep. Seth Moulton, but a recent poll shows a firm lead for Markey.

title: What will the Red Sox target this offseason? Craig Breslow maps out Boston’s priorities.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox seek a top pitcher to join Garrett Crochet and start playoff games, according to Craig Breslow.
Potential pitcher targets include Joe Ryan, Freddy Peralta, and MacKenzie Gore via trade, or free agents like Dylan Cease.
In addition to resigning Alex Bregman, the team aims to boost their lineup with a power hitter this offseason.

title: Zdeno Chara’s 10 most memorable moments with the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Zdeno Chara inducted into Hockey Hall of Fame; served as Bruins captain for 14 seasons.
Chara signed with the Bruins in July 2006, sparking a two-decade period of team contention.
Chara won the 2009 Norris Trophy and set the NHL hardest shot record at 108.8 mph.

title: Bill Belichick reflects on ‘learning curve’ during first season coaching college football
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick reflects on coaching challenges during first season with UNC, emphasizing a learning curve in player positioning.
UNC sits tenth in ACC with a 4-5 record; needs two more wins to match last season's total of six.
Belichick acknowledges early-season struggles but notes recent back-to-back victories against Syracuse and Stanford as improvements.

title: Patriots have 15 players land on injury report, but get some good news
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: 15 New England Patriots players appear on the injury report ahead of their Thursday game against the Jets.
Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson return as limited participants following hamstring and toe injuries.
Tight end Austin Hooper misses practice due to a concussion after the win against the Buccaneers.

title: Georgia man allegedly stole millions in unclaimed Mass. property
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Shaka Stayman, 44, from Atlanta, faces 25 charges including larceny and money laundering for stealing unclaimed Massachusetts property.
Stayman allegedly cashed $1.1 million and attempted to claim an additional $2.2 million using falsified documents.
He is held on a $2 million bail in Massachusetts and awaits sentencing for a separate federal case in Alabama.

title: TreVeyon Henderson explained why he looked at the sideline during key TD run
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson scored a crucial touchdown for the Patriots despite uncertainty on whether to run down the clock.
The rookie running back considered sideline signals during his 100+ yard performance, his best game with multiple touchdowns.
Coach Mike Vrabel credited Henderson's successful run to effective blocking by Mack, Hooper, Campbell, and Tonga.

title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei returned to the Bruins lineup with two assists in a 5-3 win against Toronto after being benched.
Lohrei was benched for five games due to defensive struggles and replaced by Jonathan Aspirot.
Coach Marco Sturm's benchings have motivated multiple Bruins players to improve their performances this season.
